metadata.title: CVE-2017-2888 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable integer overflow vulnerability exists when creating a newRGB Surface in SDL 2.0.5. A specially crafted file can cause an integeroverflow resulting in too little memory being allocated which can lead to abuffer overflow and potential code execution. An attacker can provide aspecially crafted image file to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl1.2debian - 2.0.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.8+dfsg1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl1.2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.6+dfsg1-2ubuntu2').
libsdl2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.8+dfsg1-1ubuntu1.18.04.1').
